h2101.definition: from {{h2100}}; a seminal or menstrual flux; issue.

h2102.definition: or (by permutation) זִיד; a primitive root; to seethe; figuratively, to be insolent; be proud, deal proudly, presume, (come) presumptuously, sod.

h2103.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2102}}; to be proud; in pride.

h2104.definition: plural probably from the same as {{h2123}}; prominent; Zuzites, an aboriginal tribe of Palestine; Zuzims.

h2105.definition: of uncertain origin; Zocheth, an Israelite; Zoheth.

h2106.definition: apparently from the same root as {{h2099}} (in the sense of prominence); an angle (as projecting), i.e. (by implication) a corner-column (or anta); corner(stone).

h2107.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2151}}); probably to shake out, i.e. (by implication) to scatter profusely; figuratively, to treat lightly; lavish, despise.

h2108.definition: from {{h2107}}; probably scattering, i.e. removal; used adverbially, except; beside, but, only, save.

h2109.definition: a primitive root; perhaps properly, to be plump, i.e. (transitively) to nourish; feed.

h2111.definition: a primitive root; properly, to shake off, i.e. (figuratively) to agitate (as with fear); move, tremble, vex.

h2112.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2111}}; to shake (with fear); tremble.

h2113.definition: from {{h2111}}; agitation, fear; be removed, trouble, vexation. Compare {{h2189}}.

h2114.definition: a primitive root; to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be a foreigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery; (come from) another (man, place), fanner, go away, (e-) strange(-r, thing, woman).

h2115.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h6695}}); to press together, tighten; close, rush, thrust together.

h2116.definition: from {{h2115}}; trodden on; that which is crushed.

h2117.definition: probably from the root of {{h2123}}; prominent; Zaza, an Israelite; Zaza.

h2118.definition: a primitive root; to shove or displace; loose.

h2119.definition: a primitive root; to crawl; by implication, to fear; be afraid, serpent, worm.

h2120.definition: feminine active participle of {{h2119}}; crawling (i.e. serpent); Zocheleth, a boundary stone in. Palestine; Zoheleth.

h2121.definition: from {{h2102}}; boiling of water, i.e. wave; proud.

h2123.definition: from an unused root apparently meaning to be conspicuous; fulness of the breast; also a moving creature; abundance, wild beast.

h2124.definition: apparently from the same as {{h2123}}; prominence; Ziza, the name of two Israelites; Ziza.

h2125.definition: another form for {{h2124}}; Zizah, an Israelite; Zizah.

h2126.definition: from {{h2109}}; well-fed; or perhaps an orthographical error for {{h2124}}; Zina, an Israelite; Zina.

h2127.definition: from {{h2111}}; agitation; Zia, an Israelite; Zia.

h2128.definition: from the same as {{h2203}}; flowing; Ziph, the name of a place in Palestine; also of an Israelite; Ziph.

h2129.definition: feminine of {{h2128}}; a flowing; Ziphah, an Israelite; Ziphah.

h2130.definition: patrial from {{h2128}}; a Ziphite or inhabitant of Ziph; Ziphim, Ziphite.

h2131.definition: (Isaiah 50:11) (feminine); and זִק; or זֵק; from {{h2187}}; properly, what leaps forth, i.e. flash of fire, or a burning arrow; also (from the original sense of the root) a bond; chain, fetter, firebrand, spark.

h2132.definition: probably from an unused root (akin to {{h2099}}); an olive (as yielding illuminating oil), the tree, the branch or the berry; olive (tree, -yard), Olivet.

h2133.definition: from {{h2132}}; olive grove; Zethan, an Israelite; Zethan.

h2135.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2141}}); to be translucent; figuratively, to be innocent; be (make) clean, cleanse, be clear, count pure.

h2136.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2135}}; purity; innocency.

h2137.definition: from {{h2135}}; properly, transparency, i.e. glass; crystal.

h2138.definition: properly, passive participle of {{h2142}}, but used for {{h2145}}; a male (of man or animals); males, men-children.

h2139.definition: from {{h2142}}; mindful; Zakkur, the name of seven Israelites; Zaccur, Zacchur.

h2140.definition: from {{h2141}}; pure; Zakkai, an Israelite; Zaccai.

h2141.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2135}}); to be transparent or clean (phys. or morally); be (make) clean, be pure(-r).

h2142.definition: a primitive root; also as denominative from {{h2145}}; properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention; to be male; × burn (incense), × earnestly, be male, (make) mention (of), be mindful, recount, record(-er), remember, make to be remembered, bring (call, come, keep, put) to (in) remembrance, × still, think on, × well.

h2143.definition: or זֶכֶר; from {{h2142}}; a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration; memorial, memory, remembrance, scent.

h2144.definition: the same as {{h2143}}; Zeker, an Israelite; Zeker.

h2145.definition: from {{h2142}}; properly, remembered, i.e. a male (of man or animals, as being the most noteworthy sex); × him, male, man(child, -kind).

h2146.definition: from {{h2142}}; a memento (or memorable thing, day or writing); memorial, record.

h2147.definition: from {{h2142}}; memorable; Zicri, the name of twelve Israelites; Zichri.

h2148.definition: or זְכַרְיָהוּ; from {{h2142}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has remembered; Zecarjah, the name of twenty-nine Israelites; Zachariah, Zechariah.

h2149.definition: from {{h2151}}; properly, a shaking, i.e. perhaps a tempest; vilest.

h2150.definition: by reduplication from {{h2151}}; tremulous, i.e. a twig; sprig.

h2151.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2107}}); to shake (as in the wind), i.e. to quake; figuratively, to be loose morally, worthless or prodigal; blow down, glutton, riotous (eater), vile.

h2152.definition: or זִלְעָפָהxlit zilʻâphâph corrected to zilʻâphâh; from {{h2196}}; a glow (of wind or anger); also a famine (as consuming); horrible, horror, terrible.

h2153.definition: ; from an unused root apparently meaning to trickle, as myrrh; fragrant dropping; Zilpah, Leah's maid; Zilpah.

h2154.definition: or זַמָּה; from {{h2161}}; a plan, especially a bad one; heinous crime, lewd(-ly, -ness), mischief, purpose, thought, wicked (device, mind, -ness).

h2155.definition: the same as {{h2154}}; Zimmah, the name of two Israelites; Zimmah.

h2156.definition: or זְמֹרָה (feminine); and זְמֹר (masculine); from {{h2168}}; a twig (as pruned); vine, branch, slip.

h2157.definition: from {{h2161}}; intriguing; a Zamzumite, or native tribe of Palestine; Zamzummim.

h2158.definition: or זָמִר; and (feminine) זְמִרָה; from {{h2167}}; a song to be accompanied with instrumental music; psalm(-ist), singing, song.

h2160.definition: feminine of {{h2158}}; song; Zemirah, an Israelite; Zemira.

h2161.definition: a primitive root; to plan, usually in a bad sense; consider, devise, imagine, plot, purpose, think (evil).

h2163.definition: a primitive root; to fix (a time); appoint.

h2164.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2163}}; to agree (on a time and place); prepare.

h2165.definition: from {{h2163}}; an appointed occasion; season, time.

h2166.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h2165}}; the same as {{h2165}}; season, time.

h2167.definition: a primitive root (perhaps identical with {{h2168}} through the idea of striking with the fingers); properly, to touch the strings or parts of a musical instrument, i.e. play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music; give praise, sing forth praises, psalms.

h2168.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2167}}, {{h5568}}, {{h6785}}); to trim (a vine); prune.

h2169.definition: apparently from {{h2167}} or {{h2168}}; a gazelle (from its lightly touching the ground); chamois.

h2170.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2167}}; instrumental music; musick.

h2171.definition: (Aramaic) from the same as {{h2170}}; an instrumental musician; singer.

h2172.definition: from {{h2167}}; a musical piece or song to be accompanied by an instrument; melody, psalm.

h2173.definition: from {{h2168}}; pruned (i.e. choice) fruit; best fruit.

h2174.definition: from {{h2167}}; musical; Zimri, the name of five Israelites, and of an Arabian tribe; Zimri.

h2175.definition: from {{h2167}}; musical; Zimran, a son of Abraham by Keturah; Zimran.

h2176.definition: from {{h2167}}; instrumental music; by implication, praise; song.

h2177.definition: from {{h2109}}; properly, nourished (or fully developed), i.e. a form or sort; divers kinds, × all manner of store.

h2179.definition: a primitive root meaning to wag; used only as a denominative from {{h2180}}; to curtail, i.e. cut off the rear; smite the hindmost.

h2180.definition: from {{h2179}} (in the original sense of flapping); the tail (literally or figuratively); tail.

h2181.definition: a primitive root [highly fed and therefore wanton]; to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah); (cause to) commit fornication, × continually, × great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish.

h2182.definition: from {{h2186}}; rejected; Zanoach, the name of two places in Palestine; Zanoah.

h2184.definition: from {{h2181}}; adultery, i.e. (figuratively) infidelity, idolatry; whoredom.

h2185.definition: regarded by some as if from {{h2109}} or an unused root, and applied to military equipments; but evidently the feminine plural active participle of {{h2181}}; harlots; armour.

h2186.definition: a primitive root meaning to push aside, i.e.; reject, forsake, fail; cast away (off), remove far away (off).

h2187.definition: a primitive root; properly, to draw together the feet (as an animal about to dart upon its prey), i.e. to spring forward; leap.

h2188.definition: from {{h2111}} (in the sense of {{h3154}}); perspiration; sweat.

h2189.definition: by transposition for {{h2113}}; agitation, maltreatment; × removed, trouble.

h2190.definition: from {{h2111}}; disquiet; Zaavan, an Idumaean; Zaavan.

h2191.definition: from an unused root (akin (by permutation) to {{h6819}}), meaning to dwindle; small; little.

h2193.definition: a primitive root; to extinguish; be extinct.

h2194.definition: a primitive root; properly, to foam at the mouth, i.e. to be enraged; abhor, abominable, (be) angry, defy, (have) indignation.

h2195.definition: from {{h2194}}; strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin); angry, indignation, rage.

h2196.definition: a primitive root; properly, to boil up, i.e. (figuratively) to be peevish or angry; fret, sad, worse liking, be wroth.

h2199.definition: a primitive root; to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly; assemble, call (together), (make a) cry (out), come with such a company, gather (together), cause to be proclaimed.

h2200.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2199}}; to make an outcry; cry.
